results.title: The Adventures of a bluebottle
results.brief_description: A light-hearted autobiographical commentary on the life cycle of a blue bottle, from new laid egg to airborn maturity. Sequences include the laboured burrowing of the chrysalis through a bed of loose stones and and the wriggling, writhing and eventual rending of the cocoon. The relating of the single embryo to a swarm of its fellows simplifies the process in the life cycle.

results.title: The Adventure = L'Avventura
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Amato Pennasilico, Cinematografiche Europee, Cinematographique Lyre and Cino Del Duca
results.brief_description: This was the film which brought Antonioni to international prominence, and was the first part of a loose trilogy which comprised ‘La Notte’ and ‘L’Eclisse’. Out of the slight story of a young woman who disappears on an island during a cruise in the Mediterranean, Antonioni conjures one of the defining texts of 1960’s ‘art cinema’ - highly formalised, deeply personal and quintessentially cinematic. Starring Monica Vitti. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Advancing flame
results.creator_credit: Derek Stewart Productions and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: Shows a cross section of heavy and light industries where oil fuel is used to advantage in the United Kingdom, Germany, Holland, Sweden and Switzerland. Research and development to achieve higher efficiencies in modern industries investigates drop size distribution, flame radiation, gas flow in boilers, and high intensity combustion, which may well influence plant design and processes in future.

results.title: The Adolescent
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun, ExPro George Movshon, United Nations Films and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: ‘De Dam’ in Amsterdam is the capital of adolescent Europe, a town square beside a canal where the young of four continents gather, talk, sing and love. In its search to find and know what the new generation thinks and feels about the world, the United Nations sent a camera crew to the Netherlands, spoke to many youths from England, Canada, Denmark, Switzerland and Malaysia, and caught a wide variety of attitudes on many public issues.

results.title: The Accessible Arctic
results.brief_description: Convincing evidence of the growing advance of industry and settlement in the Canadian far north. New roads, railways and airfields have brought the once isolated northern communities into the mainstream of Canadian life and progress. Explains how this is being done and shows some of the people who are doing it. Among these are Indian and Eskimo graduates of the new trade schools.

results.title: The Abode of peace
results.creator_credit: Ow Kheng Law, B.H. Hipkins and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: The British Protected Sultanate of Brunei lies on the northern coastline of the island of Borneo, between North Borneo and Sarawak. This film is an account of Brunei’s struggle to preserve the best of an old civilisation while using the new prosperity brought by the discovery of oil in the territory to build roads, schools and hospitals.

results.title: The ABC of unions
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A group of high school students, reacting against their harsh music master, devise an analogous story about why there are trade unions. They learn all about arbitration, bargaining and compromise. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The ABC of puppets
results.creator_credit: Portia Hawley and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film in two parts. Part 1 illustrates the processes of making a glove puppet in detail. Part 2 shows the construction of a stage for the puppets and their manipulation. The story of Hansel and Gretel is performed.
